post_text: 2024 was a year filled with challenges, firsts, and growth. I‚Äôm so thankful for all the people I got to share it with, all our partners who share in our mission and supporting sustainability and our co-founders Kimberly Reilly & Megan Hayes for creating Everybody Water . The joy is in who you share it with üíô #waterwithaheart

more_relevant_posts.post_text: üåç Happy Earth Day! üå± As we celebrate our planet, let's also reflect on the actions we're taking to protect it for generations to come. üêò It's easy to talk about sustainability goals, but turning those words into impactful actions is where the real challenge lies. üõùHow are you creating a space where imagination meets action, and where optimism fuels meaningful change for your coworkers, family and friends? üí¨ Share in the comments below!

Even from the comfort of Sweden, it was exciting and rewarding to follow and support our communication at Climate Week New York. Listen in below to hear our CEO, Jesper Brodin , speak with the New York Times and Patagonia on how the consumer industry can decarbonize value chains and enhance product circularity. It's good business to be a good business! Beyond knowledge sharing, Climate Week is also a key time for delivering key policy asks to the public sector. By advocating for systemic change, brands like IKEA can make it easier for all in society to join the energy transformation - widening the scope of our positive impact. To enable the transformation across society, Ingka Group welcomes the following actions from governments: ‚úîÔ∏è Increase greenhouse gas reduction targets in line with the 1.5¬∞C target to halve emissions by 2030 and reach net zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2050 at the latest. ‚úîÔ∏è Set short and long-term policies within their NDCs in line with the 1.5¬∞C target to finance and accelerate the transition to renewable energy, circular economy, as well as sustainable transport, food systems, reducing food waste, agriculture, and forestry. ‚úîÔ∏è Accelerate the renewable energy transition and phase out fossil fuels that still account for most of the energy demand. Invest in necessary infrastructure and streamline permitting processes to enable businesses and people to reduce their greenhouse gas emissions faster. https://lnkd.in/dfB3Mpk6 #ClimateWeekNYC #CommittoClimate

A Positive Shift Our world is facing unprecedented challenges, from climate change to social inequality. To address these issues, we need a fundamental shift in our mindset. A positive work attitude can ripple out into our personal lives and communities. When we find fulfillment in our work, we are more likely to make choices that benefit society and the environment. Digital technologies have provided us with powerful tools to connect, collaborate, and create positive change. Consider Patagonia, a company that donates a significant portion of its profits to environmental causes. By integrating environmental stewardship into their business model, they have inspired countless others to follow suit. It's time for organizations to prioritize purpose over profit. By fostering a culture of positivity and sustainability, we can create a better future for ourselves and generations to come. Let's embrace technology, reduce our greed, and increase our love for one another.

It's been less than a week since #ClimateWeekNYC 2024 and we're still buzzing from all the great conversations and collaboration. Events like this are a great opportunity to come together and drive positive change towards a healthier and more sustainable future üå≥ Here's a snapshot of our week! #NYClimateWeek #Bupa #Sustainability
Time to move beyond words, towards action! We all have a role to play in creating a sustainable future. Let's embrace responsible practices and advocate for change. #EarthDay #Sustainability

Excited to celebrate #WorldEnvironmentDay today! üåç As a farmer‚Äôs daughter, I‚Äôve had the privilege of learning directly from Mother Nature. Each cycle of planting and harvesting has shown me the importance of balance, resilience, and sustainable practices. These aren‚Äôt just lessons for farming‚Äîthey‚Äôre lessons for life. üü£As we reflect on our relationship with the environment, let‚Äôs consider sustainability at every level. It‚Äôs about individual actions and corporate responsibility alike. Whether it‚Äôs reducing waste, recycling, or supporting eco-friendly initiatives, we all have a role to play. üü£For business owners, this means integrating sustainability into our business models and operations. It‚Äôs not just good ethics; it‚Äôs good business. As individuals, small actions like planting trees, starting a garden, or even choosing local produce can make a big difference. üü£Let‚Äôs use today to commit to protecting our planet with joy and enthusiasm. After all, every effort counts in creating a sustainable future for all. üü£So let‚Äôs have some fun while we‚Äôre at it‚Äîengage in nature, make sustainable choices, and inspire others to do the same. Together, we can make a real impact! üå±‚ú®
Check out Rheem's latest Sustainability Progress Report!

Mark your calendars for 4 December and join us online to discover the next steps in sustainable IT! This event is open to everyone interested in driving change in IT sustainability. Register today! #TCOCertified #Sustainability #ITproducts

Monday mindset: Let‚Äôs kickstart the week with a commitment to sustainability. Join Meister in making a difference, one small step at a time. #sustainability #environmentalconservation #climatechange

What an incredible discussion at Pure Strategies: Connecting Climate and Nature with Planet-Forward Strategies during #ClimateWeekNYC ! It was inspiring to hear examples of ways that companies can align climate initiatives with nature-based solutions to drive meaningful, planet-forward strategies. In the life sciences industry, addressing the intersection of climate and nature isn‚Äôt just about environmental stewardship‚Äîit‚Äôs also about enhancing patient outcomes and building more resilient healthcare systems. By integrating nature-based solutions and sustainable practices, we can contribute to a healthier planet while advancing innovations in healthcare.

post_text_html: 2024 was a year filled with challenges, firsts, and growth. I’m so thankful for all the people I got to share it with, all our partners who share in our mission and supporting sustainability and our co-founders Kimberly Reilly & Megan Hayes for creating Everybody Water. The joy is in who you share it with 💙#waterwithaheart

video_duration.post_text: üêù I‚Äôm deeply honored to share that I‚Äôm stepping into the role of Chief Product Officer at Bumble Inc. ! This is more than just a professional milestone for me - I‚Äôve always been passionate about creating products that help people connect and build meaningful relationships, and I can‚Äôt think of a better place to carry on this work than at Bumble. I believe that technology can help us solve human problems in many untapped ways. I actually met my wife Sara online, so I have a profound appreciation for how tech products can facilitate online introductions that end up changing the course of our lives in incredibly meaningful ways - so Bumble‚Äôs goal to redefine online to real world connections to help people find real, authentic relationships couldn‚Äôt be more exciting to me. The company‚Äôs mission and determination to lead with its values of kindness, respect and equality to drive healthy relationships resonates with me deeply, and I‚Äôm excited to help shape the future of Bumble‚Äôs product experience alongside such a talented team. Over the last two decades working in both consumer and enterprise organizations, I‚Äôve learned the power of customer-centric innovation, experimentation, and exceptional design. Most recently at Salesforce, I had the privilege of working with some of the world‚Äôs leading brands to create transformative e-commerce solutions. Now, I‚Äôm looking forward to bringing those insights to Bumble as we continue building products that truly make a difference. I‚Äôm energized by the vision and pace of innovation set by Lidiane Jones , so here‚Äôs to an exciting new chapter - I can‚Äôt wait to get started! üíõ

more_relevant_posts.post_text: üöÄ Excited to share my latest project at Bumble! üöÄ At Bumble, we recognize that date planning can often be a stressful and repetitive task, leading to suboptimal dating experiences. As a Product Manager on the Growth Team, I am thrilled to be working on a solution to tackle this challenge head-on. Our goal is to simplify the date planning process by providing personalized and innovative suggestions to our users. By addressing the confusion over where to meet, where to eat, and what to do, we aim to enhance the overall dating experience and make it more enjoyable for everyone. üìà Key Objectives: Enhance user engagement and satisfaction Drive revenue growth and strengthen brand value Reduce user churn by improving the dating experience Stay tuned for more updates as we continue to innovate and create seamless, enjoyable dating experiences for our users! Bumble Inc. NextLeap #ProductManagement #Bumble #DatingApp #UserExperience #Innovation

Q4 pressure is here, and for media buyers, it's go-time. Many brand owners are understandably nervous about hitting their goals, especially with the challenges Meta has presented in 2024. It‚Äôs easy to feel the weight of these expectations and the outside voices telling you how to do your job. But here‚Äôs the thing: You‚Äôve got this. You've already done the hard work, tested strategies, and honed your campaigns. Right now, the key is to double down on what's working. Focus on the proven concepts that have delivered results and trust the data that‚Äôs in front of you. At the end of the day, success in Q4 is about execution. Stick to the fundamentals, keep optimizing, and remember ‚Äî you‚Äôre the expert in the driver‚Äôs seat. Let your results do the talking. L F G üí™üöÄ

Viral wins aren‚Äôt the ones that grow your business (or lead to happiness). The DTC space in 2025 needs less of: - Chasing the perfect ROAS on Meta - Bragging about revenue spikes over short periods - Obsessing over email open rates that hit an all-time high And more: - Sharing where things went wrong and what we learned - Admitting when things are down and asking for help - Opening up about the messy journey that led to what worked‚Äîeven if it took years of trial and error and may not apply to everyone What‚Äôs your 2024 REALLY been like, DTC? Share if you want to, I‚Äôm here for it.

We cut our Meta CPA targets 3 times and by almost 70% in Triple Whale üê≥ . Here's why: We took over an account that was optimizing heavily for view through conversions and returning customers on Meta (unconsciously, we hope). The team at adpros started optimizing for new customers and we cut new customer CPA targets from $300 to $150 to $100. We also completely transformed the creative strategy that's led to new winners beating the old $300 new customer CPA (NCCPA) in Tripelwhale to as low as $50 in the testing phase. It's your responsibility as a media buyer to keep decreasing CPA targets to be honest and push limits of what's possible to break records. =================================== Follow Nehal Kazim to learn how to add a million a month in revenue profitably!

I‚Äôve seen the concerns from the UEFN community about this month‚Äôs engagement payouts and how Epic‚Äôs new algorithm favors islands that attract outside audiences. I understand why people are upset, and I too want to share my perspective. We all want this ecosystem to grow in a fair and sustainable way. But business decisions don‚Äôt always feel fair, especially in a fast-changing space like this. When I started, I was balancing a regular job while creating content as a hobby. It wasn‚Äôt until I secured brand partnerships that I could fully commit to growing Alliance in this risky space. It wasn‚Äôt easy‚Äîit required strategic planning, long hours, and a constant willingness to adapt. For those who might not know, MackJack and Alliance haven‚Äôt always had the same discovery success as some of our competitors. Even though this month was one of our best for engagement, I still worry about the stability of the engagement model, which is why we‚Äôve built our business to not rely solely on engagement payouts. While I believe the recent payout changes are important for the future, I also think they may have come too soon and in the wrong order. Before making these changes, we should have been given better tools to promote and market our own games effectively. Right now, we‚Äôre stuck promoting a phone number that leads to a full Fortnite download, only for our players to face other games before even reaching ours. This isn‚Äôt helping our games succeed. What we really need are more ways to create achievements, rewards, and meaningful experiences for our players, so we can genuinely build and engage our communities. I encourage everyone to continue sharing feedback with Epic to help improve the ecosystem. But I also encourage my fellow creators to take responsibility by adapting and building the foundations needed for a sustainable career path. #UEFN

üåü We‚Äôre honored to be rated 5 stars on both Google and Yelp! üåü Exceeding expectations isn‚Äôt just what we do‚Äîit‚Äôs who we are. Whether it's elevating a brand‚Äôs visual identity or shaping a mission-driven strategy, we‚Äôre here to make a difference that matters. Take a look at what one of our amazing clients had to say, and know that helping brands reach their full potential is why we love what we do. Here‚Äôs to more journeys ahead, and even more lives impacted. üß° #5Stars #ExceedExpectations #BrandingWithPurpose
